Title.evidence: Association of Stress Hyperglycemia Ratio with Prognosis in Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: This prospective cohort study included 18,307 patients undergoing isolated CABG at the National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases, Fuwai Hospital, Beijing, from January 2013 to December 2021.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the association between SHR and prognosis in coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of in-hospital death, myocardial infarction, cerebrovascular accident, and reoperation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This prospective cohort study included 18,307 patients undergoing isolated CABG at the National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases, Fuwai Hospital, Beijing, from January 2013 to December 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The third tertile showed a 10.7% greater risk of MACCEs (HR: 1.107, 95% CI 1.023â€“1.231, P = 0.024).
